plan: In the next rounds, I'll test a mix of aggressive and conservative strategies. For high values (above 30), I'll bid up to 35 to secure wins. For mid-range values (15-30), I'll exit around 25, balancing risk and reward. For low values (below 15), I'll exit early, around 10, to minimize losses. I'll adjust based on opponents' behaviors, noting if they tend to overbid or underbid. By tracking their exit points, I'll refine my strategy, aiming to outlast them when I have a high value and exit early when my value is low, maximizing long-term profit.

In early rounds, I'll test aggressive bidding by staying in until close to my value, maximizing win chances and data on rivals' behavior. Mid-game, I'll vary strategies: exit early with low values to save losses, and push boundaries on high values to gauge competitors' limits. Late rounds will focus on optimized bidding based on gathered insights, balancing risk and profit. I'll adjust dynamically, using observed patterns to inform decisions, aiming for consistent profit maximization by leveraging knowledge of others' tendencies and potential value distributions.

In the next rounds, I'll implement a mix of aggressive and conservative strategies. Initially, I'll set my exit price just below my value to test competitors' thresholds. I'll track their exit points to identify patterns. Occasionally, I'll bid slightly above my value to gauge their risk tolerance and gather data on their valuation distribution. If I notice consistent early exits from a bidder, I'll adopt a more aggressive approach against them. Conversely, if another bidder consistently stays longer, I'll be more conservative. This adaptive strategy aims to maximize profit by exploiting observed behaviors while managing risks.
